values: So, here's how it all began.  An outline in the yard. lent a hand digging some dirt. And here's Davey, digging in the dirt.  He thought it made him butch. And here's how it looked, with the liner in, and the arber in.  It took awhile to figure out how to get the damn waterfall built. I finally decided to build it up with cement blocks.  That worked well. Here's what happens when you ask to fill the pond. And here's the final product.  I need to get the water cleared up, and put some plants and fish in, and it's ready to roll. And here's the back, and what you see from the alley. And finally a side shot.  I love the way it turned out!

So, I traded in the Bonneville for a 2006 Dodge Stratus SXT.  It's a nice dark blue metallic, with black interior.  It's definitly not the Bonneville, but is a great car.  I lowered my payment significantly, and dropped the interest rate significatanly.  So it's a much better situation than the Bonneville, and I dropped more than 45k off the mileage.  So, yay for new wheels :)

This weekend there's a group of us headed up, to cheer Don Hauser up. He's struggling with the insurance company after a fire at his house, so we decided he needed some cheering up, bear style. Anyone wanna go for the "I'm burned out party!" You can check out Bearidise by clicking the link. **UPDATE*** Here's the email I just got for the weekend, that explains the party in more detail. OK Bears! It's time to shine our love upon one of the great
Bears ... great because Don Hauser is the epitome of what Bears are
about ... loving, non-judgemental, unpresumptuous, and joyous in
life.

<<< The Story >>>

Don's house burned on October 21st and he has been staying here with
his cat "Bear" at the mansion ever since. He was a bit blue after
the fire of course, so I tried to drum up a party for him, and while
the 3 of us did have a good time, it was a bit low-key. It turned
out that I had chosen a particularly busy weekend for everyone, and
John Straw got in touch in December and wanted to do up the party
right for Don ... but the date he chose Don was going to be in
England ... but now, it is ALL SET UP! This weekend we get the
privilege of honoring Don Hauser with what looks like a huge event,
and I really can't think of a more deserving recipient!

John Straw & Brad have been doing a lot of behind-the-scenes
marketing and food planning, and on this end I'm extending the Mardi
Gras decorations into this event! We'll have pirogies in quantity
Saturday Night with the famous spinach salad. John is planning on
having his exotic spinach dip, a cheesecake or two, and other
Bearish treats!

Don knows we're having a pretty large event, but he doesn't know it
is for him ... the cover story is that John had a previous
engagement Mardi Gras weekend and wanted to do a Bearidise run! We
have a lot of overnight people here, at least 7 so far, and I
understand that quite a few people are considering coming up Friday
Night, which would be grand. I'm not sure we can manage to keep it
all a secret until Saturday, but hey, we'll try!

I do appreciate your generous donations to Bearidise to help keep
this important place going, but please come and say hi to Don under
any circumstances! He will shine back to you the love you give him,
and it will be a truly wonderful experience for us all.

On Saturday Night, I will have a computerized slide show in the
media room showing a bit of the history of Don and his relationship
to the club over the years, and I'll be presenting him with a
special gift after a video clip of s similar situation years ago!

So do, please, come out this weekend, the 8th-10th, and share with
the Bear who has shared so much with us all, these many years ...
Don Hauser.

I hope everyone had a special day today!    and I got up this morning and headed up to Punkin Ridge to spend the day with Gram, Pap, Sharon, Don, Joe and Missy.  We exchanged gifts as soon as we got there, then napped for a bit till dinner was ready.  Gram of course made far too much food.  After dinner we did our white elephant gift exchange.  That's always fun, since ya never know what you're going to end up with.  We got home about 7:45 tonight.  I'm happy the narrows by Lewistown is now 4 lanes, that has knocked off 20 mins or more from our trip.  The new I-99 is partial open, and knocked off almost 30 mins coming home.  We did the trip is just over 2 hours! Yay!  That's cut an hour off the trip from what it used to be.  I think once I-99 is done, that's easily going to take a good 45 mins off the trip. Not a lot going on, other than that.  Tomorrow's work, Weight Watchers (if I've only gained 2lbs or less, I'm happy), Thursday will be wings, and then the weekend will be prep for the New Year's Eve party.  Found our first ornament casualty when we got home.  Apparently Lucy and Rowan knocked one off the tree in the den.  At least it wasn't one of the expensive ones.  Ok, time for bed!

1. Wrapping paper or gift bags? Gift bags
2. Real tree or artificial? artificial and real
3. When do you put up the tree? Day after Thanksgiving
4. When do you take the tree down? Sometime after the New Year
5. Do you like eggnog? Love it! Lot's of rum please.
6. Favorite gift received as a child? I would say my Easy Bake Oven. hehe
7. Do you have a nativity scene? yes, a couple
8. Hardest person to buy for? <lj user="pennbear">
9. Easiest person to buy for? <lj user="scottcub">
10. Worst Christmas gift you ever received? a velvet paint by numbe
11. Mail or e-mail Christmas cards? mail 
12. Favorite Christmas Movie? National Lampoon's Christmas 
13. When do you start shopping for Christmas? Last week. lol
14. Have you ever recycled a Christmas present? I think maybe once.
15. Favorite thing to eat at Christmas? Fudge...chocolate fudge.
16. Clear lights or colored on the tree? There are clear lights and gold. 
17. Favorite Christmas song? Oh Holy Night.
18. Travel at Christmas or stay home? We do both, Punkin Ridge and Harrisburg
19. Can you name all of Santa's reindeers? Uh, I think so.
20. Angel on the tree top or a star? Bows and an angel.
21. Open the presents Christmas Eve or morning? We normally do Christmas Eve, but this year it'll be Christmas Day
22. Most annoying thing about this time of year? Not nearly enough hours in the day.
23. What I love most about Christmas? The decorations


I hope everyone has a safe, happy and joyous holiday season!

He was thinking the same thing I was last night!

"Relationships suck. Period. There is no perfect relationship. If someone says they have one, they're lying. Every relationship has ups and downs. Most have more downs than ups, but it's the height of the ups that counters the downs. This is why when people first start dating, they don't notice those little things that drive them nuts. Because they just don't compare overall. Yet ask anyone who has a 10+ year relationship about what annoys each other and they'll start a list a mile long.

And when I say relationships i am covering ALL relationships, not just the sex ones. Friendships are a relationship after all. And no, the world is not out to get you. People may avoid you though if you continue to tell everyone that so and so just hates you. Or that those "A-listers" dislike you. There's no A-list. It's YOUR inadequacies projected onto other people. If you are shy about approaching someone, be honest with yourself, but don't blame them because THEY are being mean and don't like you. If you sit alone in a dark bar and don't talk to anyone, why do you wonder why people think you are that creepy guy in the corner. At the same time, if you are constantly getting wasted and groping every guy in sight... you're the creepy gropey guy. Find a GOOD middle-ground."

I couldn't have said it better myself!

<P> So, here's what the patio looked like before we started.  Well, left side anyway. Here's  working on removing the cement.  It was rather easy to bust up and remove. A 1/3 of the way done! And it's all done!! I started patching up the stucco that was broken or missing on the walls, I started in the cornor. We used the tiller to loosen up all the dirt.  That saved us a lot of back breaking digging!  I think that  had far too much fun with it! So much fun, he tilled up the entire backyard!  looking all sexy and stuff. I think Steve was hoping that Keith would uh, pack him!  putting in the first few blocks.  kept saying "Please sir, can I have another?"  That board disappeared.  I think he took it home with him. Yay! First section done!!  was thinking there was a naked man in front of him for some reason.  Just look at that tongue hanging out! And it's all finished!  In one day even! I'll post the second part next.

Any big plans for the weekend?  

Saturday we're doing some more work on the backyard and patio (shhhhh, <lj user="scottcub"> doesn't know yet) and no plans Saturday evening.

Sunday,  <lj user="pennbear"> and Paul are hosting what is probably going to be the last pool party/potluck of the year.  If you've got nothing to do, swing by! Let me know if you need more info.

Monday, that's still up in the air as well. Any suggestions?

Today is sucking, more changes to what we do.  And they aren't good changes. 

Happy Thursday!

So, tomorrow, I'm going to work for a couple hours.   That'll help make up for the time I missed this week.   <lj user="scottcub">, <lj user="shavedheadpenn">, and <lj user="joecub"> are going to finish up the sidewalk tomorrow. It looks like I'll be making an unexpected trip to  Punkin Ridge.  My grandmother called me awhile ago, and informed me that my grandfather is in the hospital. So I'm going up there at some point tomorrow.  For now he seems to be fine, but I'm not entirely sure what's going on. 

I'm off to bed for now.  I'm beat!
You are evil.  I hope everyone eats you, preferably before I have even a sliver of your sugary goodness.

Evil, evil .  He was mean like this all weekend. This was how  spent his weekend, tied up.  The big wet spot that 's ass left on the chair, after he was tied to it. A very dirty Sonata! And the ever fabulouse Stan. And here's  blowing uh, bubbles. Hehe, bubbles.  Shiney sparkly bubbles. Bubbles?  Where? Is it time for bubbles? No, seriously, it was a Shar Pei! Or so says .

Boo hooo hoooo....the poor Shar Pei! This was the most innocent that  was all weekend. But really, here's EVIL .  The missing Lesbian, er, I mean Birkenstocks.   was missing these all weekend.  I want to know how they got in the tree! And a very weighted down, packed full Sonata.

The past couple weeks have been pretty hectic.  Last week I finally figured out I had an infection in my eyelid, which is why my eye has been bothering me for weeks.   After a visit to my dr, and then to an opthamologist, I was given an anitbiotic that cleared it up in a couple days.  Friday, I ripped down the wood covering over the patio, and the old insulation. I found 2 HUGE dormant wasp nests.  Nasty!  By Saturday, I was feeling really worn out, and run down.  Sunday I was even weaker.  By Monday, I barely could get out of bed.  I called my Dr, and did as she told me to do.  I wasn't much better today, so I went into the office. I apparently have some sort of viral infection as a result of the dust and dirt I inhaled from the insulation.  It also could be from the large wasp nests. So that's what's been going on.  I was able to celebrate, at least a little bit with the old men  and .   Great parties for both of them.  There are now pics a coming :)

Bullet points seem to be the theme this week, so I'm following the lead.  But I'm going to do this Jeopardy style. A ~ I was chasing the Shar pei from a couple sites down through the woods, and I tripped on a root and fell down. Q ~  , why are your knees muddy?  A ~ Is your name Mike?  You look like a long lost friend of mine from high school, he was such a nice guy. Q ~ What did a drunk Stan say to some random boy at the bonfire? A ~  You've ruined paradise for me! I'm going home today. Q ~ Do you know what you've done to me this weekend? A ~ Oh, that's just  sleeping in a chair. Q ~ What's the big pink blob?  So, I know, I'm late. I've been very busy.  We had a great time overall. I'm happy to report that  didn't have bladder control issues, and didn't pee his pants.  I did find out I'm far too fat and out of shape to climb up and down hills.  The weather was perfect, warm during the day, and cold at night.  We met some great new folks, and got to see the beloved Connecticut bitches.  We also figured out just how much shit can be packed into the Sonata, and still have backseat passengers.  ended up spending the night, and riding home with us Sunday. I'll do another update shortly.

We didn't do a lot this weekend.   Saturday morning, I got  and  outta bed after us being out late boozing to head to York to the Greatest Yard Sale.  I found some good buys, some goodies I know I'm going to make some nice cash off of.  We bumped into , her hubby and their neighbor.  We chatted with them for awhile (it was easy to find the man in the skirt and cowboy hat!)  I never did see , , and .  We got tired, and  had an afternoon commitment, so we headed out.   and I went to Goodwill, and then a yard sale, and finally headed home, with a stop at Maple Donuts.  *drools*  I came home, and did some power cleaning.  We ended up at the Brownstone, and hung out with Brian C. for awhle.  We had a great time! Sunday was another great day poolside at 's.  What a great and relaxing time!  And of course, the food.  Yummmmm.  No frozen deviled eggs from Sam's Club from  this time though.  She did treat us to a wardrobe malfunction.  I have pictures I'll post later.  Yes, there are pictures. I'm not sure I want to traumatize everyone.  But maybe I will.  Anyway, I made some great sangria again.  It was great hanging out with , , , , , Nicole, little Austin, Barry and David, and of course, our wonderful host .  Sadly, he was a bit under the weather.  But a good time was still had! So that's about it.  Not much going on till the weekend, for Bear Happy Hour.  And boy, there's a wild crew coming to town from up north.  Everyone better look out! Ha! Headed to bed now.

<lj cut text="It's long and boring">

I've been slack at updating lately.  I'm going to look back in a few years, and think I was actually busy doing something useful!  The reality is that I'm not. haha. Work sucks, and I hate what I do more and more every day. I've applied for a couple other positions, but haven't gotten any where with them.  They have just hired like 12 new people, I'm waiting to see if that helps the situation or not.  I hate the thought of interviewing for a new job, and starting all over again. 

We've been layin pretty low lately, and not running as much.  We took <lj user="scottcub">'s new car on it's first big trip this past Sunday.  We went up to Punkin Ridge for the day.  It was a nice trip out, but rained the entire way back.  Gram and Pap's house looks odd now.  They had to thave the dormer on the front of the house removed, since it kept leaking.  I also checked out the new addition Joe put on his garage. How's that for excitement!

I've also been doing fairly well on my Ebay sales.   I do still have a lot of junk that hasn't sold, but it's slowly selling on my store.  I enjoy hitting the flea markets, thrift stores etc lookin for new merchandise to sell.  I've found some great stuff, that's sold quickly.  

I dropped off the Bonneville last night at Faulkner's.  They hadn't fixed the seat after my accident back in April.  So they gave me a free loaner car, and are supposed to fix it today.  I haven't heard from them yet.  It best be fixed, otherwise it'll get ugly. ha!

We've not done much to the house lately either.  We need to get the patio torn out and the new one installed. That's the big project for the year.  Perhaps we can get that started tonight. 

That's about all that's been going on lately.
Can't just one good thing happen today?  Just one?  It's been a craptacular day.

I know, I'm way behind on this...I wanna go out to dinner and celebrate my birthday tomorrow night.

Who wants to go?  And suggestions where?

5pm is the time :)

I'm gonna celebrate my big 24th birthday for the rest of the month :)

But Happy Mother's Day to the Mom's on my list.  And there are a few of ya floating around out there!   Oh, yeah, and to the Nana's *cough cough <lj user"richcub2002"> cough cough*  out there as well :)

There is a Bear Trek and Bear Hunt posting coming as well.  I started it!
